node.title: Early season fires takes out mobile phones at Sisters Beach
node.alt: Bushfire smoke rises above green trees
node.description: Mobile phone reception remains cut to a small town in Tasmania's north-west after a bushfire damaged telecommunications infrastructure.
node.content:
["A fire that has been burning at Sisters Beach in Tasmania's north-west\u00a0has been upgraded to the watch-and-act level.", "That\u00a0fire \u2014 which started on private property near Lake Llewellyn \u2014\u00a0burned\u00a0through about 450 hectares of land and damaged telecommunication infrastructure.", "Mobile phone reception is currently impacted in the area, and it is unclear when it will be restored.", "In an update issued this afternoon, the Tasmanian Fire Service said the fire had been upgraded from advice level to watch and act, and that it may impact Lake Llewellyn later in the day.", "", "
The fire started on private property on Saturday.(Supplied: Nigel Weeks)
", "The TFS said the fire was\u00a0currently travelling east, towards Lake Llewellyn, and was\u00a0expected to be \"difficult to control\" because\u00a0conditions were\u00a0expected to worsen.", "Tasmania Parks and Wildlife Service is\u00a0helping fight\u00a0the fire, along with crews from the TFS.", "There is currently no evacuation order in place.", "Yesterday, helicopters were brought in to help fight the blaze which created a smoke alert for the Rocky Cape area.", "Waratah-Wynyard man Robbie Walsh said it was worrying to see a bushfire of its scale so early in the season.\u00a0", "\"Sisters Beach has only got one way in and one way out and it's a worry when a fire like this happens,\" Mr Walsh said.", "\"Sisters Beach is surrounded by national park, which is a very [high fuel]\u00a0area and it is a worry.\"", "", "
The fire burned\u00a0through about 450 hectares.(Supplied: Lisa Fagg)
"]
